    • Constructor Detail

      • Edge

        public Edge(int directionality,
            Vertex left,
            Vertex right)
        This is the default constructor for Edge.
        Parameters:
        directionality - if this parameter is -1 it is Right-to-Left, if this parameter is 0 it is bidirectional and if it is 1, it is Left-to-Right.
        left - the left-hand vertex
        right - the right-hand vertex

      • Edge

        public Edge(Vertex left,
            Vertex right)
        This is the convenience constructor for Edge. It is bidirectional by default.
        Parameters:
        left - the left-hand vertex
        right - the right-hand vertex

      • toUnidirectional

        public Edge toUnidirectional(int directionality)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        This method returns a unidirectional edge if the edge is bidirectional
        Parameters:
        directionality - the directionality to set
        Returns:
        a unidirectional edge with the directionality as specified
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the directionality is invalid
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the current edge is unidirectional

      • toBidirectional

        public Edge toBidirectional()
                     throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        This method returns a bidirectional edge from a unidirectional edge.
        Returns:
        a bidirectional edge
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the current edge is bidirectional

      • toSwappedEdge

        public Edge toSwappedEdge()
                   throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        This method returns a unidirectional edge in the opposite direction of the current unidirectional edge.
        Returns:
        a swapped unidirectional edge.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the current edge is bidirectional it cannot be made unidirectional

      • equivalent

        public boolean equivalent(Edge e)
        This method is a weaker form of the equals method. While the equals method checks for strict equality of directionality, left, and right nodes, this method says that two edges are equivalent if they fulfill one of two of the following parameters:
        • the two are considered strictly equal
        • the two are mirrors of each other
        This second condition is saying that the edge A ← B is equivalent to the edge B → A.
        Parameters:
        e - the edge to check against for equivalence
        Returns:
        if the edges are equivalent as described above
